programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hokies try to get even with the Hurricanes. On Jan. 13, Miami held off Virginia Tech 75-71 for a third straight series triumph despite career highs of 33 points and 10 rebounds from the Hokies' Sean Pedulla. The Canes protect a 10-2 home mark.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Cavaliers try to maintain their grip on the Tigers in an ACC game. Virginia has won three straight meetings, and 14 of the last 15. Clemson comes off a 70-65 victory over Louisville. Tigers center PJ Hall scored 25 points in that contest.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Cougars tip off with the No. 8 Jayhawks for the first time in over 20 years. Kansas last played and beat Houston in a 2001 Maui Invitational consolation match. The Cougars have won five in a row to jump to the top of the Big 12 table.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 7 Duke and No. 3 North Carolina, the top teams in the ACC, meet for the first time this season. The Blue Devils have won 11 of their past 12 overall, and swept the Tar Heels in 2022-23. UNC comes off a shocking one-point loss to Georgia Tech.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: A top-10 showdown in the Bluegrass State pits the No. 10 Wildcats (15-5, 5-3 SEC) against the No. 5 Volunteers (15-5, 5-2). Both sides come off of losses, with Tennessee falling to South Carolina on Jan. 30 and Kentucky losing to Florida a day later.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: West Coast Conference powerhouses in the Bulldogs and Gaels renew their rivalry. Gonzaga (12) and Saint Mary's have combined to claim the last 15 WCC championships. The Bulldogs won the last meeting, 77-51 in the 2023 WCC Tournament title game.

The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Blood, Sweat & Tears
programme.desc: Previewing major Top Rank boxing events with in-depth interviews and behind the scenes access to fighter training camps and their home lives.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. joins Field Yates to break down the top prospects in the coming NFL draft.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hawkeyes return home as the Buckeyes provide the opposition. Iowa is 9-3 on its court. In 2022-23, the Big Ten foes split the regular-season set, but Ohio State came out on top 73-69 in a second-round upset at the conference tournament.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Three-game win streaks are on the line as the No. 13 Bluejays (16-5, 7-3 Big East) host the Bulldogs (14-7, 5-5). Creighton also defends its three-game win streak against Butler after winning both of last season's clashes by over 20 points.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Wolf Pack band together looking for revenge over the Spartans. Nevada had won five straight meetings with San José State before the Spartans ousted the Pack from the 2023 Mountain West Tournament quarterfinals. Nevada is 10-1 at home this season.
